summary: This is a certificate of authenticity from Amazon employee Milonie Caldwell, declaring that documents produced by Amazon in response to a law enforcement request (reference CRIM1031692, Case 19 MAG 5896) are authentic business records. It was executed in Seattle, Washington, as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Milonie Caldwell
persons.role: Law Enforcement Response Specialist at Amazon
persons.context: Amazon employee who signed the certificate of authenticity declaring that documents produced by Amazon in response to a law enforcement request are authentic business records.

events.title: Execution of Amazon Certificate of Authenticity
events.description: Milonie Caldwell, an Amazon Law Enforcement Response Specialist, signed a certificate of authenticity declaring that documents produced by Amazon in response to law enforcement request CRIM1031692 (Case 19 MAG 5896) are authentic business records.

keyFacts: Amazon produced documents in response to law enforcement request CRIM1031692 for Case 19 MAG 5896, which is related to the Epstein investigation.
Milonie Caldwell, an Amazon Law Enforcement Response Specialist, certified that the produced documents are authentic business records created in the ordinary course of business.
The certificate was executed on August 30, 2019, in Seattle, Washington, under penalty of perjury.
The document indicates Amazon's compliance with a subpoena or law enforcement request in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.
